g.text: Do Not Cite, Quote or Distribute
in willingness to pay, in line with the technology
large number of iterations, such that in 2020 over three billion solar panels have been produced.
Compared to, for instance, approximately 1000 nuclear reactors that were ever constructed, a million
doing were available to solar PV: to make incremental
improvements, to introduce new manufacturing equipment, to optimise that equipment, and to learn
from failures. More generally, recent work has point to the benefits of modularity in the speed of
While many technologies do not fit into the solar model, some, including micro nuclear reactors and
direct air capture, also have modular characteristics that make them s
and benefit from solar’s drivers. However, PV took solar 60 years to become cheap, which is too slow
for addressing climate change if a technology is now still at the lab scale. A challenge in learning from
l is therefore to how to use public policy to speed up innovation over much shorter time
There are many definitions of policy mixes from various disciplines
studies. Generally speaking, a policy mix can be characterised by a combination of building blocks,
namely elements, processes and characteristics, which can be specified using different dimensions
include (i) the policy strategy with its objectives and principal
plans and (ii) the mix of policy instruments, and (iii) instrument design.
is the result of policy processes.
Both elements and processes can be described by t
in terms of the consistency of the elements, the coherence of the processes, and the credibility and
comprehensiveness of the policy mix in different policy, governance, geography and temporal context
he evaluation of policy mixes include framework
conditions, the type of policy instrument and the lower level of policy granularity, namely design
. In addition, many have argued the
need to craft policies that affect different actors in the transition, some supporting and some
Learning from the innovation systems literature, some of the recent policy focus is not only directed on
innovation policies that can optimise the
innovation system to improve economic competitiveness and
growth but also policies that can induce strategic directionality and guide processes of transformative
connect innovation policy with societal challenges and
with a variety of actors and ideas and incorporating equity, nowadays often referred to as a just transition
(Newell and Mulvaney 2013; Swilling et al. 2016; Heffron and McCauley 2018; Jasanoff 2018)
Chapter 17). This new policy paradigm is opening up a new discursive space, shapes
omes, and is giving rise to the emerging idea of transformative innovation policy
Transformative innovation policy has a broader coverage of the innovation process with a much wider
participation of actors, activities and modes of innova
tion. It is often expressed as socio
. Transformative innovation policy encompasses different ideas and concepts that
aim to address the societal challenges involving a variety of discussions including social innovation
